lines.text: Are you going to bring me that martini, or do I have to suck it out of the glass from here?
Am I talking to an actor now, or a human being?
Neither sir, I'm a policeman.
Was that a tear? How do you people do it? Do you poke yourself in the eye? Or are you thinking right now "My dog is dead"?
What's the matter with you? Are you enjoying this?
Enormously! "My dog... is dead".

[after FINALLY clearing Customs]
Which door's England?
How long will you be staying in this country, sir?
That's a very good question.
Yes, I thought so, too.
Sorry I get a little bit insensitive, but I'm a hitman!
What are you? C.I.A., Mafia?
Both.
Please don't call me by my real name, it destroys the reality I'm trying to create.
She told me about the letters.
Letters? What letters?
The letters. She told me about them. I know all about the letters. How do you think I know? She told me. That's how I found out.

[about Wallace]
I never knew someone could forgot so much without a severe blow to the head.

[to Daggenhurst]
If we cannot trust each other, how can we bring back Cold War together?

[Wallace is being shot at]
Time out! Time out! I got something in my eye, jagoff!
Blockbuster... Des Moines.
Spencer, did you flush?
I think she's gonna do that, don't you, pal? I'll ask her. Lori!

[Quietly to Daggenhurst]
He's talking to her!
She's still in the bowl?
Maybe he tried to flush her, but she floated back up!
Tell him to flush her! Spencer knows how to deal with floaters.
Stay away from that phone!
[shoots phone]
What are you doing with one of our communicators, Cochran?
This man refused to provide me with any identification.
Of course he didn't provide you with any identification. He's a secret agent.

[a constable asks Wallace to see his license after a high speed chase]
No, you may not! But I do have this nifty communicator with which you can speak directly to my superiors.

[On the communicator/cigarette case]
Breaker, breaker, come on back to that big ol' HQ, come on back to me.
Who is this?
This is Spencer.
So you're still using that name, are you?

[to his assistant]
How he mocks us.
Yo matey, you just stabbed me with your pen.

[in a singsong voice]
Gilbert's gone.
Why so gloomy? Is better than being butcher.
I like being butcher. You know exactly who you are killing. And why.
[cocks the gun]
You know, for half a second back there I thought I saw a real human being.
Nobody asked me to be a human being.
So what's the pay like then?
They pay all your expenses, you're licensed to kill, but there's a down side.
What's that?
Torture.
There's the women, though.
Well, they're nice after the torture. Believe me.
Not much of a car they've given you though, is it?
Oh, it's a piece of crap! They've got an Aston Martin... had trouble with the surface-to-air missiles, so it's in the shop.
Ah.
Excuse me, no pass, no entry.
I'm looking for a tall American.
Aren't we all, dear, but we've got a show to put on, in case you didn't notice.
[last lines]
Is this working? Are you liking it?
